solution_line_template: Each boat will require {boat_width} feet across to fit itself and {side_space} feet space on one side for a total of {side_space}+{boat_width} = <<{boat_width}+{side_space}={feet_per_boat}>>{feet_per_boat} feet per boat

The last boat will need an additional {last_boat_extra_space} feet space on its other side, so this {last_boat_extra_space} feet should be subtracted first from the {river_width} feet which leaves {river_width}-{last_boat_extra_space} = <<{river_width}-{last_boat_extra_space}={usable_river_width}>>{usable_river_width} feet
{feet_per_boat} feet per boat on the remaining {usable_river_width} feet for a total of {usable_river_width}/{feet_per_boat} = <<{usable_river_width}/{feet_per_boat}={max_boats}>>{max_boats} boats
